intro: Bromus unioloides var. haenkeanus, commonly known as the slender brome, is a grass species native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its ability to colonize new areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant ecology.
